block.p: Janel Elizabeth Clague, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Martin C. Clague of Rye, N.Y., was married at Rye Presbyterian Church yesterday to Matthew Thomas Kost, the son of Christine Amitrano of Albany and Dr. Franklin C. Kost of Schenectady, N.Y. The Rev. Daniel H. Love officiated with the Rev. Dr. James G. Clague, an Episcopal priest and a grandfather of the bride.

The couple, both 28, work at Fidelity Investments in Boston; the bride is a senior human resources representative, and the bridegroom a quality assurance engineer of computer software in the institutional brokerage department.

Janel Elizabeth Clague, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Martin C. Clague of Rye, N.Y., was married at Rye Presbyterian Church yesterday to Matthew Thomas Kost, the son of Christine Amitrano of Albany and Dr. Franklin C. Kost of Schenectady, N.Y. The Rev. Daniel H. Love officiated with the Rev. Dr. James G. Clague, an Episcopal priest and a grandfather of the bride.

The couple, both 28, work at Fidelity Investments in Boston; the bride is a senior human resources representative, and the bridegroom a quality assurance engineer of computer software in the institutional brokerage department.

Mrs. Kost graduated from Simmons College. Her father, who retired as the vice president for e-business solutions at I.B.M. in White Plains, is a management consultant in Rye. Her mother is a human resources consultant in Rye.

Mr. Kost graduated from the University of Massachusetts. His mother is the head of the lower school at Albany Academy. His father is a professor of mathematics at the State University College at Oneonta, N.Y. The bridegroom is the stepson of Sergio Amitrano and Anne Kost.
